article_text:
PARIS—Rémy Cointreau SA is convinced China won't stay frugal forever.

The French drinks maker was hammered again in its latest quarter by China's crackdown on corruption, which has had a chilling effect on spending for luxury goods and fancy dinners.

But the owner of Rémy Martin Cognac said there isn't any reason to cut prices or launch...

twitter.description: Rémy Cointreau's sales fell 22% in its latest quarter, as China's crackdown on gift-giving hampered the French drinks maker.
twitter.title: Rémy Cointreau's China Woes Continue

image.alt: Rémy Cointreau sales have been hit by China's crackdown on gift-giving

But the owner of Rémy Martin Cognac said there isn't any reason to cut prices or launch...
